Office of Science,</subfield><subfield code="c">2011.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="264" ind1=" " ind2="2"><subfield code="a">Oak Ridge, Tenn. :</subfield><subfield code="b">Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="300" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">7 pages :</subfield><subfield code="b">digital, PDF file.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="336" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">text</subfield><subfield code="b">txt</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacontent</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="337" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">computer</subfield><subfield code="b">c</subfield><subfield code="2">rdamedia</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="338" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">online resource</subfield><subfield code="b">cr</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacarrier</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Published through SciTech Connect.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">12/01/2011.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">"fermilab-pub-11-643-ppd"</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">"arXiv eprint number arXiv:1112.0858"</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Phys.Rev.Lett.108:081801,2012 FT</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Aaltonen, T.; Alvarez Gonzalez, B.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Antos, J.; Apollinari, G.; Arisawa, T.; Appel, J.A.; Albrow, M.G.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">We have observed exclusive γ production in proton-antiproton collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using data from 1.11 ± 0.07 fb⁻¹ integrated luminosity taken by the Run II Collider Detector at Fermilab. We selected events with two electromagnetic showers, each with transverse energy E{sub T} > 2.5 GeV and pseudorapidity </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 1.0, with no other particles detected in -7.4 < η < +7.4. The two showers have similar E{sub T} and azimuthal angle separation Δφ ≈ π; 34 events have two charged particle tracks, consistent with the QED process p{bar p} → p + e⁺e⁻ + {bar p} by two-photon exchange, while 43 events have no charged tracks. The number of these events that are exclusive π°π° is consistent with zero and is < 15 at 95% C.L. The cross section for p{bar p} → p + γγ + {bar p} with </subfield><subfield code=" ">< 1.0 and E{sub T} (γ) > 2.5 GeV is 2.48{sub -0.35}{sup +0.40}(stat){sub -0.51}{sup +0.40}(syst)pb.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-07CH11359</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Physics "fermilab-pub-11-643-ppd" "arXiv eprint number arXiv:1112.0858" Phys.Rev.Lett.108:081801,2012 FT Aaltonen, T.; Alvarez Gonzalez, B.; Amerio, S.; Amidei, D.; Anastassov, A.; Annovi, A.; Antos, J.; Apollinari, G.; Arisawa, T.; Appel, J.A.; Albrow, M.G. Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star We have observed exclusive γ production in proton-antiproton collisions at √s = 1.96 TeV, using data from 1.11 ± 0.07 fb⁻¹ integrated luminosity taken by the Run II Collider Detector at Fermilab. We selected events with two electromagnetic showers, each with transverse energy E{sub T} > 2.5 GeV and pseudorapidity  < 1.0, with no other particles detected in -7.4 < η < +7.4. The two showers have similar E{sub T} and azimuthal angle separation Δφ ≈ π; 34 events have two charged particle tracks, consistent with the QED process p{bar p} → p + e⁺e⁻ + {bar p} by two-photon exchange, while 43 events have no charged tracks. The number of these events that are exclusive π°π° is consistent with zero and is < 15 at 95% C.L. The cross section for p{bar p} → p + γγ + {bar p} with  < 1.0 and E{sub T} (γ) > 2.5 GeV is 2.48{sub -0.35}{sup +0.40}(stat){sub -0.51}{sup +0.40}(syst)pb.
